description: I'm fundraising with my pals at Relay for St. Jude. This year, I am turning the punishment on *myself* by hand-crafting a "red wagon" like those used by patients at St. Jude receiving treatment. Blood, sweat, and tears - all for the kids at St. Jude!

rewards.name: Handmade Cutting Board
rewards.description: Donors who contribute $200 or more in a single donation will receive a hand-crafted wooden cutting board (likely made on-stream). MVO Woodworks cutting boards are made of fine American hardwoods, sealed with mineral oil and beeswax, and may last a lifetime of use.

rewards.name: Red Wagon Premium Sponsorship

The wooden red wagon will be donated to Relay for St. Jude to be featured on set during next year's Podcastathon!

name: Kingsrook vs. Childhood Cancer
description:
Every year my favorite podcast network, Relay, raises money for St. Jude Children's Research Hospital.  One of their co-founders had a son that was cured at St. Jude, and it's amazing to hear the story of what they do there.  

I've been happy to donate to this cause for the last few years, but now, I decided to go a step further, and launch my own campaign, that I could send to my friends and family, to help raise even more money for this great cause. 

Join us, to help save kids lives.

name: The Marco Offset
description:
I'm fundraising for St. Jude's Research Hospital as a sub-campaign of Relay's campaign. The theme of this fundraiser is for people to donate the amount of their 'The Marco Offset'. 

'The Marco Offset' is a way of calculating a donation amount based on how much extra you are paying for a new iPhone off the base price is how much you should also donate to St. Jude's. This process was discussed on Accidental Tech Podcast Episode  551.

You can calculate your amount on themarcooffset.com

name: Aaron's St. Jude Fundraiser 2024
description: Hey everyone! My absolute favorite podcast network, RelayFM, is doing their annual fundraiser for St. Jude Children's Hospital and this year I'm helping them raise money! St. Jude is a really unique place in that not only do they treat children with cancer, but they also do not require a single penny from the families of the children. They are only able to do that because of the donations of people like you. They also share much of their cancer research across the globe. Thank you for donating!

name: Icon Intervention for St. Jude
description:
If you know me, I’ve probably talked your ear off about two things:

1. The importance of accessible healthcare
2. Where icons should be placed on your phone’s home screen

If you donate $5 or more, you can access a database of home screens I’m compiling. Donate $25 or more, I will showcase your own phone’s home screen and tell you why it’s bad. 

Whoever donates the most amount of money at the end of the month is allowed to design the layout of my home screen for a month. I am at your mercy.

name: fundraisingForStJudeWithWalther
description:
It's that time of year again and I am once again raising money for Relay's (Switch On) St Jude campaign to end childhood cancer. St. Jude is a wonderful organization that provides heath care to children with cancer for no charge to their family, and Relay is the host of many of the podcast I love and online personalities that I follow.
If you don't mind throwing a few cons to your Walther for a good cause, could you think about donating 10$, 5$, or 1$ to a good cause.

name: Cure for Kids: Fund Research and Treatment
description:
Support Childhood Cancer Research and Treatment

Join us in the fight against childhood cancer by supporting vital research and treatment efforts at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital. Our journey began when our beloved daughter was diagnosed with ganglioneuroblastoma, a rare form of childhood cancer. Thanks to the incredible support and advanced treatments she received at Peyton Manning Children's Hospital, we are filled with happiness and optimism for her bright future.

name: Holdiniful's Relay
description: I'm fundraising for St. Jude Children's Research Hospital. St. Jude is leading the way the world understands, treats and defeats childhood cancer and other life-threatening diseases. Their researchers and doctors work together to turn laboratory breakthroughs into lifesaving treatments for children from across the United States and around the world. With our support, St. Jude can provide cutting-edge treatments at no cost to families — so they can focus on helping their child live.

name: Neurospicy Queers for Relay FM for St. Jude 2024
description: This September, for Childhood Cancer Awareness Month, I'm raising $20,000 for the Relay FM for St. Jude Children's Research Hospital campaign. Your donation can make a real difference in the lives of children fighting cancer. Cancer has touched my life in profound ways. I lost both my grandfathers to this devastating disease. But I've also witnessed the power of hope and advanced medical care. My best friend from high school survived cancer thanks to hospitals and programs like St. Jude.

name: Marcus Twichel for St. Jude's
description: As someone with two healthy little boys, I can't imagine if a doctor's visit someday revealed the worst possible news a parent can receive. I want to support St. Jude's hard work to end childhood cancer worldwide so no parent has to experience that pain.

rewards.name: 1 Hour Code Review/Chat with Marcus
rewards.description: I will meet with your virtually one-on-one to talk through any development question you have or do live code review.

rewards.name: No More Chemo Party
rewards.description: Your donation could help provide a No More Chemo Party to St. Jude patients and families as a fun way to celebrate the end of chemotherapy.

rewards.name: New Toy for Hospital Play Areas
rewards.description: Your donation could help provide a new toy for hospital play areas or recreational areas at St. Jude housing facilities.

rewards.name: Art Supplies
rewards.description: Your donation could help provide art supplies to St. Jude patients who use these supplies to explore their creativity, express themselves and just have fun!

rewards.name: Red Wagon
rewards.description: Your donation could help provide red wagons to St. Jude patients. Red wagons are the preferred mode of travel through the halls of the hospital for our youngest patients.

rewards.name: Groceries for Family
rewards.description: Your donation could help provide groceries for a family for two weeks. St. Jude provides patients and their families with meal cards for breakfast, lunch and dinner in Kay Kafe, the hospital's cafeteria.

rewards.name: Two Days of Oxygen
rewards.description: Your donation could help cover two days of oxygen for a St. Jude patient.

rewards.name: One day of chemotherapy for a St. Jude patient
rewards.description: Your donation could help cover one day of chemotherapy for a St. Jude patient. Treatments invented at St. Jude have helped push the overall survival rate for childhood cancers from 20% when the hospital opened in 1962 to more than 80% today.
